creator: Averton Engineering
title: MIDI 5V LED Strip Light Controller for the Spielatron or Other MIDI Synth
description: This controller flashes tri-colour LED strip lights for 50mS per note, with colors mapped to specific MIDI note ranges (Blue: G5 to D#6, Red: E6 to B6, Green: C7 to G7). It functions as an ALSA MIDI device, allowing MIDI software to control the LEDs simultaneously with a MIDI synth device like the Spielatron.
steps: Route a Printed Circuit Board using the provided dxf file.
Populate the PCB with three 10K resistors, three BD681 NPN Darlington transistors, and single in-line header strips according to the schematic diagram.
Mount the PCB onto the 3D printed plastic stand-off mount.
Terminate the leads on the 5V tri-colour LED strip, noting the pin order (5V +ve, blue, red, green).
Connect the LED strip leads to the header on the PCB, ensuring the first pin (5V +ve) is on the correct side.
Program the Arduino Nano with the provided .ino file, which checks the MIDI value of the note and selects a color for the LEDs based on its value.
Send a piece of music to the MIDI light controller to observe the LEDs flashing according to the note values.
